page.title: 11Religion; Nailsea Churches
page.content: {Holy Trinity Church}is the oldest church in Nailsea Town, dating from the last part of the 13th century. It is for this reason that the area around it, which includes our School, is known as the Old Church area of Nailsea. This was originally to distinguish it from the "new" Church, {Christ Church}built in 1842 on the other side of the Town. This year,in March, the{new extension to Holy Trinity Church was opened on the north side of the church. Also this year, work was started on the new{Roman Catholic Church}of St. Francis near the junction of Queen's Road and Ash Hayes Road. Two other places of worship in Nailsea are the{United Reformed Church}and the {Methodist Chapel.}The 13th Cent.{St. {Bride's Church}in the tiny hamlet of Chelvey is also in our survey area.
